title: Oil Price Jumps as U.S. Supplies Drop
text:
Oil prices rose Wednesday morning after the U.S. government said supplies of crude and refined products like gasoline were declining, the first such drop in six weeks.

The Energy Information Administration reported that U.S. commercial crude-oil inventories fell by 1.7 million barrels last week from the previous week and are now at five-year average levels for this time of year. In addition, gasoline inventories fell by 3.1 million barrels last week, slightly above five-year average levels. An oversupply of crude and petroleum...
description: Oil prices rose Wednesday morning after the U.S. government said supplies of crude and refined products like gasoline were declining, the first such drop in six weeks.
